rename.from: Top and bottom clipping when `decorations` set to `none` on Windows
rename.to: Top and bottom clipping when maximized and `decorations` set to `none` on Windows

body: Which version? Is this a regression or can you reproduce it with previous versions too?

I tried `0.9.0` and `0.10.0` but the `Windows + Up` key doesn't work to maximize the window. I also tried setting `startup_mode: Maximized` in my `alacritty.yml`, but it doesn't maximize on open for any version of `alacritty`.
What about adding a `Maximize` key binding manually?

Huh, you're right. Must have confused it with `Minmize`.

Which Windows version are you on?
It seems like a similar issue with https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/3662#issuecomment-1324785128, your capture is like to my capture.

issue.title: Windows maximize size incorrect on Windows without decorations

repository.name: winit
repository.description: Window handling library in pure Rust

issue.body:
See https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/6515:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25470747/202878783-3b943f98-53be-4229-a2bd-d3e38d4bf8f0.png)

It seems like the calculation for maximized size is always done based on the window size including decorations.

rename.from: Top and bottom clipping when maximized and `decorations` set to `none` on Windows
rename.to: Window clipping when maximized and `decorations` set to `none` on Windows

body:
This issue is still reproducible for me when alt tabbing into minimized alacritty windows with `decorations: none`, changing `dynamic_padding` or adjusting `padding` `x` and `y`, had no effect.
Rather instead of maximizing, which no longer breaks this, it still occurs on alt tabbing to minimized.
alacritty 0.12.0 (5a728195)
Windows 10
One year later,  I think Windows Terminal is an option you can try.
